page.title: 20Housing - Whiteparish
page.content: The central part comprises rows of 18th.C.& 19th.C. cottages & houses fronting the A27, & a few older proper -ties some, such as Abbotstone House & Young's Farmhouse,standing in spacious grounds. These two are listed as Grade 2 buildings as is Welsteads-two timber framed cottages]{In 1086 DOMESDAY BOOK The Lynches, in Dean Lane, is an early 17th.C. house with diaper - patterned brickwork, stone-mullioned windows & rusticated gate-piers. Red brick is the most usual building material for both traditional & modern housing; roofs are generally tiled though some cottages are roofed with slate. Modern residential development has augmented the historic layout.{Since 1951}about 210 dwellings{(70% increase)}have been built,mainly as infilling, replacement or in small groups. From information kindly supplied by Mr.B.J.Woodruffe.
